title: Robo Shankar
text:
Robo Shankar is an Indian <a href="standup%20comedian">standup comedian</a> who has appeared in character roles in <a href="Tamil%20cinema">Tamil films</a>. He made his breakthrough with <a href="Star%20Vijay">STAR Vijay</a>'s "Kalakkapovathu Yaaru", performing standup comedy. He is a now cast as regular on several shows on Star Vijay and has presented television shows for the channel.
Career.
Shankar was a mimicry artist when he was offered by <a href="Gokul%20%28director%29">Gokul</a> a role in "<a href="Rowthiram">Rowthiram</a>" (2011); however, his scenes were edited out from the film. Gokul again cast him a role in "<a href="Idharkuthane%20Aasaipattai%20Balakumara">Idharkuthane Aasaipattai Balakumara</a>" (2013), which gave him a break as an actor. After doing small roles in "<a href="Yaaruda%20Mahesh">Yaaruda Mahesh</a>" and "<a href="Kappal">Kappal</a>", <a href="Balaji%20Mohan">Balaji Mohan</a> cast Shankar in "<a href="Vaayai%20Moodi%20Pesavum">Vaayai Moodi Pesavum</a>" (2014). His performance was described by critics as "scream". He portrayed a negative character in "<a href="Touring%20Talkies">Touring Talkies</a>" (2015). He then acted in "<a href="Maari%20%28film%29">Maari</a>" (2015), where his performance was mentioned by critics that he "deserves a special mention" and "steals the show with his unique one-liners and body language".
He has visited and performed stage shows in more than 30 countries.
Personal life.
His daughter Indraja made her acting debut in "<a href="Bigil">Bigil</a>", as one of the women soccer players.
